edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.method

Class Method

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.method.Method
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentromereFinding3DMethod, CentromereFindingMethod, ChromosomeCentromereFindingMethod, DynamicMethod, RecursiveThresholdingMethod, ScriptMethod, SeededWatershedMethod, TestMethod, ThresholdingSizeMethod, TimeAveragingMethod, TimepointSplittingMethod, WatershedMethod

    public abstract class Method
extends Object
implements Runnable
    An analysis method that can be run in an independent thread of execution.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller

    • Method Detail

      • iterateOnFiltersAndStoreResult

        protected void iterateOnFiltersAndStoreResult(List<Filter> filters,
                                  WritableImage toProcess,
                                  Metric m)
        Runs through a sequence of Filters and applies them successively to an input image; quantifies images according to the supplied metric and the mask that results from application of the filters.
        Parameters:
        filters - The List of Filters to apply to the image, in order.
        toProcess - The Image that will be processed by the Filters; may be overwritten during the filtering process.
        m - The Metric that will be used to quantify the Images.

      • storeImageOutput

        protected void storeImageOutput(Image im)
        Stores an Image to an internal list of Images that can later be written to disk.
        Parameters:
        im - The Image to add to the list of output Images.

      • storeDataOutput

        protected void storeDataOutput(Quantification q)
        Stores a Quantification to be used as the data for ouptut.
        Parameters:
        q - The quantification object that will be used as output.

      • clearImageOutput

        protected void clearImageOutput()
        Clears all Images that have been stored for output.

      • go

        public abstract void go()
        Runs the analysis method.

      • getStoredImage

        public Image getStoredImage()
        Gets the first in the list of stored output Images. Will not remove the image from the list, so successive calls can return the same Image.
        Returns:
        The first Image in the list of stored output Images, or null if no Images have been stored.

      • getStoredImages

        public List<Image> getStoredImages()
        Gets the entire list of stored output Images. If no Images have been stored, this method will return an empty list. Classes extending Method should retain this behavior so that the users can iterate over the returned (potentially empty) list without having to check for null or special values.
        Returns:
        The entire list of stored output Images (may be empty).

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(ParameterDictionary params)
        Sets the parameters for this method to those found in a supplied ParameterDictionary. This retains a reference to the ParameterDictionary and does not copy it, so external changes to the ParameterDictionary will be reflected in the stored one as well.
        Parameters:
        params - The ParameterDictionary containing the parameters for running this method.

      • setAnalysisMetadata

        public void setAnalysisMetadata(AnalysisMetadata am)
        Sets the analysis metadata for this method to those found in a supplied ParameterDictionary. This retains a reference to the AnalysisMetadata and does not copy it, so external changes to the AnalysisMetadata will be reflected in the stored one as well. Also sets the parameters and images associated with this method to be those contained in the AnalysisMetadata object.
        Parameters:
        am - The AnalysisMetadata containing the metadata for running this method.

      • setImages

        public void setImages(ImageSet images)
        Sets the Images to be quantified/processed for this method. If there is one Image that is to receive special treatment (for example, one color channel to be segmented, and this used to quantify all the channels), then that Image should be specified in the ImageSet using its setMarkerImage method. This method will not overwrite any Images already passed using prior calls this method, but rather append the supplied Images to the list of those already passed in. However, if a marker image has already been passed in in a previous ImageSet, it will not be changed by calling this method.
        Parameters:
        images - The List of images to be processed/quantified.

      • getParameters

        public ParameterDictionary getParameters()
        Gets the stored ParameterDictionary used for this method. This will get a reference, not a copy, so modifications will be reflected in the stored ParameterDictionary.
        Returns:
        A reference to the ParameterDictionary used for this method.

      • getAnalysisMetadata

        public AnalysisMetadata getAnalysisMetadata()
        Gets the stored AnalysisMetadata used for this method. This will get a reference, not a copy, so modifications will be reflected in the stored AnalysisMetadata.
        Returns:
        A reference to the AnalysisMetadata used for this method.

      • getStoredDataOutput

        public Quantification getStoredDataOutput()
        Gets the stored quantification data generated by this method.
        Returns:
        A Quantification containing the quantification data, in the format specified by Metric.

      • setStatusUpdater

        public void setStatusUpdater(StatusUpdater up)

      • run

        public void run()
        Method called when the thread is started.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName()
        Gets the display name associated with the method. This will be printed as part of the output filenames from the method.
        Returns:
        a String containing the display name

      • setDisplayName

        public void setDisplayName(String name)
        Sets the display name associated with the method. This will be printed as part of the output filenames from the method.
        Parameters:
        name - a String containing the display name. This should not contain any characters that might cause problems in filenames.

      • loadMethod

        public static Method loadMethod(String methodName)
        Retrieves the method to run from its name.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to run, either fully qualified or relative to the default method package.
        Returns:
        A Method object of the type specified in the parameter dictionary.
